means: （河面上）漂浮原木造成的阻塞
（因事情太多造成的）困境，僵局

sentence.Network_en: A new initiative was needed to break the logjam.
sentence.Network_cn: 要打破僵局，就需要采取新的行动。

sentence.Network_en: Israel may be able to help break the logjam in Lebanon too.
sentence.Network_cn: 以色列或许也能帮忙打破黎巴嫩的僵局.

sentence.Network_en: The problem appears to be caused by a logjam of nerve messages.
sentence.Network_cn: 据《每日邮报》1月28日报道,常言道“一心不能二用”,而引起这一问题的关键可能是神经讯息在传递过程中受到了阻碍.

Rubbish is 39 in a logjam(浮木阻塞)and hangs from the tree’s branches. For the next three hours Robert and his team pull plastic bags, tanks.

list.abs: the irish business and employers confederation is lobbying the government to break the logjam .爱尔兰的商业与雇佣工人联盟正在游说政府来打破这个僵局。

yet , to break the logjam in the new parliament , whose members are struggling to cobble together a governing coalition , they may soon drop Mr Allawi as well .然而，新议会成员正奋力临时拼凑了一个执政联合，为了打破这种僵局，他们也可能很快放弃阿拉维。
可想而知的必然结果 a logical result打破谈判僵局 break a logjam in negotiations以理性为中心的 logocentric

entry.def: To break the logjam means to change or deal with a difficult situation which has existed for a long time.

example.ex: A new initiative was needed to break the logjam.
example.tran: 要打破僵局，就需要采取新的行动。

means.word_mean: 1. any stoppage attributable to unusual activity;
2. an immovable mass of logs blocking a river
